group.headline: The Emerald City
group.summary: Do you live in Seattle? Grow up there? Or just feel a special affinity for it? If so, welcome to the group!

group.headline: Fortress Forever - A Team Fortress Mod for Half-Life 2
group.summary: Fortress Forever is a Team Fortress mod for Half-life 2's Source Engine. Our independent team has created this mod entirely from scratch.Fortress Forever retains the classic staples, such as unique class based gameplay around a wide variety of weapons and grenades while expanding on the depth and fast flowing gameplay that team fortress fans have come to love. Fortress Forever should please those who have stuck with or been a part Half-life: TFC over the years while at the same time doing more for new TF players than any prior Fortress attempt.The game is free to those who purchase Half-life 2 or have a source package with source sdk base.

group.headline: SourceOP.com Servers and Plugins
group.summary:
SourceOP is a plugin for the Source games. It works for Half-Life 2: Deathmatch, Counter-Strike: Source, and is planned to work with both TF2 and Fortress-Forever.SourceOP adds features such as administrator commands, credits, hook, jetpack, radio, a remote administration tool, and snarks.

SourceOP hosts eight TF2 servers.

TF2 Servers:
67.228.59.145 - Valve maps, no mods
67.228.59.147 - 24/7 2fort, no mods
67.228.59.146 - 27/7 2fort, instant respawn
74.55.49.243 - Valve maps #2
74.55.49.244 - Prop hunt
74.55.49.245 - 24/7 Goldrush, no mods
74.55.49.246 - Arena maps only
67.228.59.144 - Pro rotation, no crits
HL2 DM Servers:
67.19.104.219 - Team Deathmatch, SourceOP plugin enabled
This is the official AdminOP group.

group.headline: For aspiring and veteran mappers looking for help or a friendly home.
group.summary:
Dallas server: 174.34.133.100:27500
Frankfurt server: 178.63.146.2:27015

IMPORTANT: Scroll down to the bottom of the page for news and events that you may have missed.

Proud to be the very first community created for TF2 mapping. Whether you're highly experienced or looking to start, this is the place to meet like-minded people. Share map ideas, discuss techniques, and collaborate on mapping projects. Feel free to idle in the chat room. And tell your friends!

Need to brush up on your skills? Here are links to some really great tutorials.

http://www.interlopers.net/index.php?page=tutorials

group.headline: The Fans Of AdminOP
group.summary: Hello People. Welcome on the SteamGroub page of the Fans Of AdminOP Team. Visit our server. Here is id: 87.194.121.175:27030

group.headline: Keeping Gaming Fun for Everyone
group.summary:
Professional game writers provide guides, hints, tips and more.

This is a group for us and our in-game friends.

This Steam group is an extension of our gaming company, LiTi-4 which you can learn more about from our links.

In addition to writing game guides, we also provide reviews, tips, videos and other information to gamers with the idea of keeping gaming fun for everyone.


We have some great new things planned for this New Year (including a look at the roots of gaming and online gaming) and are excited to have you join us in 2009.

If you play in game with us, feel free to join our group so you can keep in touch with us and our fellow online gamers.

If you found this Steam group from our blog, you're also welcome to join us in-game and here on the Steam group.

Remember we are not a clan, but a gaming community so we don't do scrims or competitions. We have members who are part of other clans and some who belong to no clans. This isn't a requirement to join our group.

Check out our website for our latest game guides and our blog for hints, tips, videos, news and other fun stuff.

Remember to keep gaming fun!

group.headline: TF2 in a nutshell
group.summary: Team Fortress® 2 (TF2) is the sequel to the game that put class-based, multiplayer team warfare on the map. Play as the flame-throwing Pyro, the room clearing Heavy, or the Spy, a master of disguises. Other classes include: Scout, Sniper, Medic, Engineer, Demoman, or Soldier.

Steam group for participants of the SourceOP Tournament between servers.

If you're a regular of one of the SourceOP TF2 servers and would like to participate in a tournament between servers, please ask for an invitation to this group and sign up for the forums at: www.sourceop.com

Here are the details thus far:

All teams from a specific server will play each other to determine the best on that server. The best teams from each server will play to determine the overall winning team. For fun, the second best teams will all play each other, third best, and so on.

Teams will be able to register on this website when the time comes for it. Free agents will also be able to register and teams can select free agents.

The only thing left is will it be 6v6 like 1time has proposed or 9v9 where there is one of each class like FrosT originally proposed. Vote for which you would like.

6v6 Pros and Cons
Pros:
Less spammy

Cons:
Class selection limited and usually ends up something like 2 scouts, 2 soliders, 1 medic, and 1 demo.


9v9 Pros and Cons
Pros:
More diverse class selection

Cons:
Harder to get nine people together at same time


Refer to this thread to add your vote:

http://www.sourceop.com/modules.php?name=Forums&file=viewtopic&t=1203&postdays=0&postorder=asc&vote=viewresult

More information can be found on the forums.

group.headline: The Team Fortress 2 Podkast
group.summary:
Everything TF2 is brought together for the weekly KritzKast podcast.

Updates, releases, maps, mods, fan content and far more than you'd think one little FPS should generate. Join us for the live recordings, every Sunday at 8pm (London, UK Time) www.kritzkast.com/live or download the episodes to listen to at your leasure.

Get all the info on www.kritzkast.com and stick your pin in the map on our fan page.

Yay! KritzKast have our own servers now.
They have been supplied by Clanplanet.co.uk

for a complete servers list and discount codes

VenGeaNce Server
193.200.158.213:27026

What is Highlander?
Highlander is a form of TF2 play that consists of 9v9 1 of each class. "There can be only one."

Why do we care?
Highlander completely changes the style of play involved, it makes you focus more on individual targets as opposed to just pub spam. We and many others feel this form of play isn't just a break from the normal TF2 pub, but is also more fun with a small competitive twist.

How are teams equal?
Teams are equalized with a selection method that is done by selecting 2 captains. There is then a coin toss to decide which captain gets their pick between calling captain class (the class that both captains will be playing) or picking the first player. After the captain class is picked, the captain with the first pick then selects 1 player he wants on his team. That player can then choose from the remaining 8 classes. From there, captains alternate first picks on a counter class basis. For example:
(Scout > Engineer > Spy > Pyro > Heavy > Medic > Soldier> Demo > Sniper) or
(Medic > Heavy > Sniper > Spy > Pyro > Soldier > Demo > Scout > Engineer)
Only rules of this is that Heavy and Medic as well as the Soldier and Demo are always paired together.

How does the class picking work?
A class selection moderator will then say "dot up to play (Class)". "Dotting" up means Players who wants to play that class will need to type a period (.) in the text box if they want to be considered for that class. The captains then chooses from the selection pool. If you had to sit out during the last game, you can type an exclaimation mark (!) instead. This guarantees that you will be selected by one of the captains. The first captain is not required to pick you, but the 2nd will be. If there are two or more players, then both captains are required to pick from the exclaimation pool. This is to keep the pool balanced so that everyone gets a chance to play and be fair for everyone. We appreciate the players that have to sit out since it allows a larger selection pool for the next game. Please do not exploit it.

zAlfy Rule: A player may not repeat the same class every game, for getting face raped is not fun. This does not apply if no one else wants to play the current class.

Are any weapons banned?
Sandman, Dead Ringer, Eternal Reward, Wrangler, Mad Milk, and Natasha are the current ones. Not because they are considered overpowered, but they create too much statemate in the games.

Who is invited?
Basically any solid/cool player you want to invite. Originally started with SourceOP players, but not restricted to them.

When are these held?
We will run one every Saturday 9PM Central. Currently the Saturday event is the only one being held now.

But sir you haven't provided us with enough information!
The server (provided by GamingFix)
connect 68.232.164.148:27015; password oatmeal

Ventrilo

group.headline: Bridging the Gap Between Competitive TF2 and Mapmaking
group.summary:
The idea was to make a group to hold pick up games on unfinished maps in an effort to get mapmakers feedback from a 6v6 point of view.

The pugs will primarily be held on private servers so check the event details for server and mumble connect info.

The majority of the maps will be found on TF2Maps.net so get yourself familiar with the site and it'd probably be worth while to make an account there as well.
